TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Ramenskoye in LOC . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON and PERSON . PERSON , lawyers practising in PERSON in LOC . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , the representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of murder and affray and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .

On DATE , upon the applicant 's appeal , ORG of GPE acquitted him of affray and reclassified the charge of murder to CARDINAL of manslaughter . The applicant was convicted of manslaughter and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . The court further applied an amnesty law and released the applicant from serving his sentence .

On an unspecified date the Deputy Prosecutor General lodged with the Presidium of ORG of GPE an application for supervisory review of the case , requesting it to quash the decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

On DATE the ORG of ORG granted the application , quashed the decisions and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh examination . The Presidium of ORG found , inter alia , that the courts in the previous proceedings had wrongly assessed the evidence , incorrectly applied the law and denied the procedural right of the victims to participate in the hearing before ORG on DATE . Neither the applicant nor his counsel was aware of the examination of the case by way of supervisory review on DATE .
On DATE ORG held a hearing in the presence of the applicant and his counsel . The court found the applicant guilty of murder and affray and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .
On DATE , on the applicant 's appeal , ORG of the Russian Federation reduced the sentence to DATE imprisonment .

Under LAW in force at the material time applications for supervisory review of decisions of ORG of GPE were to be considered by the ORG of ORG of GPE . No appeal was allowed against a decision of the Presidium of ORG of the Russian Federation taken on the supervisory review .
A review of the domestic law concerning supervisory review proceedings is set out in Nikitin v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE .
